column1: Multi-year sea ice area in Canadian Arctic sub-regions, 1968 to 2018

column2: Foxe Basin multi-year sea ice area (thousands of square kilometres)
column3: Kane Basin multi-year sea ice area (thousands of square kilometres)
column4: Baffin Bay multi-year sea ice area (thousands of square kilometres)
column5: Beaufort Sea multi-year sea ice area (thousands of square kilometres)
column6: Canadian Arctic Archipelago multi-year sea ice area (thousands of square kilometres)

column1: Note: Sea ice is measured during the summer season. For the Canadian Arctic domain, the summer season is defined as the period from June 25 to October 15. A statistically significant trend is reported when the Mann-Kendall test indicated the presence of a trend at the 95% confidence level.
Source: Environment and Climate Change Canada (2018) Climate Research Division.
Available on the Environmental indicators website (www.canada.ca/environmental-indicators).
